diff_hunk:
@@ -695,13 +695,13 @@
   self: hardshrink_backward(grad, self, lambd)
 
 - name: hardtanh(Tensor self, Scalar min_val, Scalar max_val)
-  self: hardtanh_backward(grad, self, min_val, max_val)
+  self: hardtanh_backward(grad, output, min_val, max_val)
 
 - name: hardtanh_(Tensor self, Scalar min_val, Scalar max_val)
   self: hardtanh_backward(grad, output, min_val, max_val)
 
 - name: leaky_relu(Tensor self, Scalar negative_slope)
-  self: leaky_relu_backward(grad, self, negative_slope)
+  self: leaky_relu_backward(grad, output, negative_slope)
body: We definitely **should** go back to using `self` if that's what real arguments are. If we ever want to pass outputs instead of `self`, we should change the THNN interface to make sure we don't break stuff when refactoring other parts of the codebase.
body_html: We definitely should go back to using self if that's what real arguments are. If we ever want to pass outputs instead of self, we should change the THNN interface to make sure we don't break stuff when refactoring other parts of the codebase.
body_text: We definitely should go back to using self if that's what real arguments are. If we ever want to pass outputs instead of self, we should change the THNN interface to make sure we don't break stuff when refactoring other parts of the codebase.
